thread.title: Key Stats From Dustin Johnson Win at 2017 Genesis Open | Golf Channel
thread.title_full: Key Stats From Dustin Johnson Win at 2017 Genesis Open | Golf Channel

title: Key Stats From Dustin Johnson Win at 2017 Genesis Open | Golf Channel
text:
Dustin Johnson easily won on Sunday at Riviera. Here are the key stats from his victory at the Genesis Open provided by the Golf Channel editorial research unit. 
Dustin Johnson 
• 13th PGA Tour victory; becomes world No. 1 for first time in career 
• 20th different No. 1 since beginning of World Ranking in 1986 
• 10th consecutive season with PGA Tour win (longest active streak) 
• Third to win 10 straight seasons immediately after turning pro since 1960 
• Other two players in that span are Jack Nicklaus (17) and Woods (14) 
• Third player in last 30 years to win 10 straight seasons on PGA Tour (Woods, Phil Mickelson ) 
• Eighth player in PGA Tour history to win in each of first 10 full seasons 
• Fourth player in PGA Tour history to win at Oakmont, Riviera and Pebble Beach 
• Other three players to do it – Johnny Miller , Sam Snead and Ben Hogan 
• 13 wins since rookie season of 2008; only Woods has more wins in span (18) 
• Fifth time since 2014 a player has won to gain No. 1 ranking 
• Snaps streak of seven straight winners on PGA Tour under 30 (age 32) 
• 10th top-5 finish in last 18 worldwide starts (four wins during that span) 
• Best score to par and most birdies of any player at Genesis Open since 2008 
• 12th player in PGA Tour history to surpass $40 million in career earnings 
• Led field in strokes gained off-the-tee and GIR this week 
• Third in field this week in strokes gained putting 
• 24th change at No. 1 (and ninth different player) since Woods lost top spot in October of 2010 Article Tags: 
Contributions from writers and editors on the Golf Channel Digital team. Editor's Picks
